name: metric-resample
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Resample a metric file to a different mesh.

Resamples a metric file, given two spherical surfaces that are in register.  If ADAP_BARY_AREA is used, exactly one of -area-surfs or -area-metrics must be specified.

The ADAP_BARY_AREA method is recommended for ordinary metric data, because it should use all data while downsampling, unlike BARYCENTRIC.  The recommended areas option for most data is individual midthicknesses for individual data, and averaged vertex area metrics from individual midthicknesses for group average data.

The -current-roi option only masks the input, the output may be slightly dilated in comparison, consider using -metric-mask on the output when using -current-roi.

The -largest option results in nearest vertex behavior when used with BARYCENTRIC.  When resampling a binary metric, consider thresholding at 0.5 after resampling rather than using -largest.

The <method> argument must be one of the following:

ADAP_BARY_AREA
BARYCENTRIC

inputs.name: current_sphere
inputs.description: a sphere surface with the mesh that the metric is currently on

inputs.name: new_sphere
inputs.description: a sphere surface that is in register with <current-sphere> and has the desired output mesh

inputs.name: area_surfs
inputs.description: specify surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

type.name: area_surfs
type.description: specify surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

inputs.name: current_area
inputs.description: a relevant anatomical surface with <current-sphere> mesh

inputs.name: new_area
inputs.description: a relevant anatomical surface with <new-sphere> mesh

inputs.name: area_metrics
inputs.description: specify vertex area metrics to do area correction based on

type.name: area_metrics
type.description: specify vertex area metrics to do area correction based on

inputs.name: current_area
inputs.description: a metric file with vertex areas for <current-sphere> mesh

inputs.name: new_area
inputs.description: a metric file with vertex areas for <new-sphere> mesh

inputs.name: opt_current_roi_roi_metric
inputs.description: use an input roi on the current mesh to exclude non-data vertices: the roi, as a metric file

inputs.name: opt_valid_roi_out
inputs.description: output the ROI of vertices that got data from valid source vertices

inputs.name: roi_out
inputs.description: the output roi as a metric

inputs.name: opt_largest
inputs.description: use only the value of the vertex with the largest weight

inputs.name: opt_bypass_sphere_check
inputs.description: ADVANCED: allow the current and new 'spheres' to have arbitrary shape as long as they follow the same contour

output-files.name: roi_out
output-files.description: the output roi as a metric
